Ah, yawn, I had that git error locally too. Perhaps they issued some kind of emergency security fix?
I would advocate just adding that git config command just before/after doing the git checkout.

Yes, there were a couple of CVE's fixed on git around the 12th of April and I can see the new package released on ubuntu focal:

https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/focal/s390x/git
So we want to add the "git config" thing probably early in {{cpp_build.sh}} and {{python_build.sh}}, I think.

From the release notes from the latest git release:

{quote}With the fixes for CVE-2022-24765 that are common with versions of
Git 2.30.4, 2.31.3, 2.32.2, 2.33.3, 2.34.3, and 2.35.3, Git has
been taught not to recognise repositories owned by other users, in
order to avoid getting affected by their config files and hooks.
You can list the path to the safe/trusted repositories that may be
owned by others on a multi-valued configuration variable
safe.directory to override this behaviour, or use '*' to declare
that you trust anything.{quote}
Setting as blocker as it will affect many setups, not only s390x.
